intro: Fridericia corchoroides, commonly known as the Brazilian broom. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil, and belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, pinnate, and often covered in fine hairs. Fridericia corchoroides is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and semi-arid regions.
